description: From Middle French giraffe (Modern French girafe), from Arabic زَرَافَة‎ (zarāfa, “giraffe”); ultimately from Persian زُرنَاپَا‎ (zornâpâ), a compound of زُرنَا‎ (zornâ, “flute”) and پَا‎ (pâ, “leg”).

entries.meaning: A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.
(Internet slang, uncommon) A very tall individual.
